Package uintTesting

Class TuitionManager

java.lang.Object
uintTesting.TuitionManager
public class TuitionManager
extends java.lang.Object
The TuitionManager class runs from Project2's main method and is the interface for commands of roster.
Author:
Zachary Goldman

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private static int INVALID_COMMAND  
    private static int QUIT_COMMAND

    TuitionManager()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private static void addStudentCommandPartOne​(java.lang.String cmd, java.lang.String name, Major major, java.util.StringTokenizer st, Roster roster)
    addStudentCommandPartOne is called by the doCommand if the command is to add a student.
    private static void addStudentWithPrinting​(Roster roster, Student newStudent)
    AddStudentWithPrinting is called by the addStudentPartOne method below when testing to see if adding a student is successful.
    private static int checkCmdValidity​(java.lang.String letters, java.util.StringTokenizer st)
    checkCmdValidity takes in the command and rest of the string in the tokenizer, checks that the command is uppercase, valid, and that the rest of the line is the correct number of tokens
    private static void doCommand​(java.lang.String cmd, java.util.StringTokenizer st, Roster roster)
    doCommand takes in the command and does the respective thing.
    private static boolean isNumber​(java.lang.String test)
    isNumber returns true if the string we're testing is a number, false otherwise in the case that we have a NumberFormatException since it can't be converted as it's not a number
    private static boolean isString​(java.lang.String test)
    isString returns false if the string we're testing is an integer, true in the case that we have a NumberFormatException since it can't be converted as it's not a number.
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    Main method
    static void run()
    Run is called by RunProject2, scans in the user's lines, checks its validity with checkCmdValidity, then sends it to doCommand unless the user entered invalid input or a Q, in which case it goes to the next line or stops the manager in the respective cases.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      public TuitionManager()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method
      Parameters:
      args - from command line, not given in our class.

    • run

      public static void run()
      Run is called by RunProject2, scans in the user's lines, checks its validity with checkCmdValidity, then sends it to doCommand unless the user entered invalid input or a Q, in which case it goes to the next line or stops the manager in the respective cases.

    • checkCmdValidity

      private static int checkCmdValidity​(java.lang.String letters, java.util.StringTokenizer st)
      checkCmdValidity takes in the command and rest of the string in the tokenizer, checks that the command is uppercase, valid, and that the rest of the line is the correct number of tokens
      Parameters:
      letters - that are the command letters in a string
      st - representing the StringTokenizer on the second token already having read in the cmd
      Returns:
      cmdIndex returns the index of command from the array of valid commands, or -1 if invalid line or command

    • addStudentWithPrinting

      private static void addStudentWithPrinting​(Roster roster, Student newStudent)
      AddStudentWithPrinting is called by the addStudentPartOne method below when testing to see if adding a student is successful. This method calls add() from the Roster class, then prints out if it worked or not.
      Parameters:
      roster - that is the roster we're dealing with
      newStudent - which is the student we're trying to add

    • isNumber

      private static boolean isNumber​(java.lang.String test)
      isNumber returns true if the string we're testing is a number, false otherwise in the case that we have a NumberFormatException since it can't be converted as it's not a number
      Parameters:
      test - string that we're checking if it's a number or not
      Returns:
      boolean that's true if a number, false if not

    • isString

      private static boolean isString​(java.lang.String test)
      isString returns false if the string we're testing is an integer, true in the case that we have a NumberFormatException since it can't be converted as it's not a number.
      Parameters:
      test - string that we're checking if it's a string or not
      Returns:
      boolean that's true if a string, false if not

    • addStudentCommandPartOne

      private static void addStudentCommandPartOne​(java.lang.String cmd, java.lang.String name, Major major, java.util.StringTokenizer st, Roster roster)
      addStudentCommandPartOne is called by the doCommand if the command is to add a student. This is in a separate method so as to make the class more modularized. Here we get the credits and extra info about the student we're adding, and then call the addStudentWithPrinting method to actually add them and print if successful.
      Parameters:
      cmd - the command we're dealing with
      name - the name of the student we're adding
      major - the major of the student we're adding
      st - the StringTokenizer holding the rest of the information of the student
      roster - the roster we're adding the student to

    • doCommand

      private static void doCommand​(java.lang.String cmd, java.util.StringTokenizer st, Roster roster)
      doCommand takes in the command and does the respective thing. If it isn't a print statement it'll check that the name and major are valid before calling other commands. If it's an adding student command, it'll call the addStudent method above.
      Parameters:
      cmd - the command we're dealing with
      st - the stringtokenizer holding the rest of the information of the student
      roster - the roster we're adding the student to
